camelcase

Convert a dash/dot/underscore/space separated string to camelCase: foo-bar → fooBar

Install

$ npm install --save camelcase

Usage

```js const camelCase = require(‘camelcase’);

camelCase(‘foo-bar’); //=> ‘fooBar’

camelCase(‘foo_bar’); //=> ‘fooBar’

camelCase(‘Foo-Bar’); //=> ‘fooBar’

camelCase(‘–foo.bar’); //=> ‘fooBar’

camelCase(‘foo__bar’); //=> ‘fooBar’

camelCase(‘foo bar’); //=> ‘fooBar’

console.log(process.argv[3]); //=> ‘–foo-bar’ camelCase(process.argv[3]); //=> ‘fooBar’

camelCase(‘foo’, ‘bar’); //=> ‘fooBar’

camelCase(‘foo’, ‘–bar’); //=> ‘fooBar’ ```

Related

  • decamelize - The inverse of this module
  • uppercamelcase - Like this module, but to PascalCase instead of camelCase
